title: Capital Felony Case Amendments

history.action: Bill Numbered but not Distributed in Legislative Research and General Counsel
Numbered Bill Publicly Distributed in Legislative Research and General Counsel
House/ received bill from Legislative Research in Clerk of the House
House/ 1st reading (Introduced) in House Rules Committee

general_provisions: This bill amends statutes related to capital felony cases.
hilighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies the statutory provisions regarding a sentencing proceeding in a capital felony case;<hr><ltbullet>requires the sentencing court to advise a defendant in a capital felony case of the right to a direct appeal and of the statutory provisions for postconviction relief;<hr><ltbullet>requires the sentencing court to appoint appellate counsel for a defendant who is sentenced to death;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the automatic review process by the Utah Supreme Court in a capital felony case in which the defendant is sentenced to death;<hr><ltbullet>addresses the priority of capital felony cases;<hr><ltbullet>addresses the extension of a report on a defendant's competency to stand trial;<hr><ltbullet>allows for the appointment of a psychologist to determine if a defendant is intellectually disabled when a prosecutor intends to seek a sentence of death;<hr><ltbullet>modifies statutory provisions regarding the pretrial process for determining whether an individual is intellectually disabled and not subject to a sentence of death;<hr><ltbullet> allows for an appeal of an order determining whether a defendant is intellectually disabled and not subject to a sentence of death;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies statutes regarding the execution of a sentence of death;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the requirements for a stay or suspension of a sentence of death and for an order of execution;<hr><ltbullet>modifies statutory provisions regarding a notification of pregnancy or incompetency of an inmate who is sentenced to death;<hr><ltbullet>addresses a petition for an inquiry on whether a defendant is competent to be executed, including the requirements for a successive petition;<hr><ltbullet>amends the examination process for a petition to determine whether an inmate is competent to be executed; <hr><ltbullet>addresses the procedures when there is a finding of competency or incompetency for an inmate sentenced to death;<hr><ltbullet>amends the subject matter jurisdiction of the Utah Supreme Court and the district court with regard to a capital felony case;<hr><ltbullet>provides that the Utah Supreme Court, after a direct appeal, appoint defense counsel to represent an individual sentenced to death on a petition for postconviction relief;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Utah Supreme Court to maintain a list of qualified defense counsel for purposes of appointing defense counsel for an individual sentenced to death on a petition for postconviction relief;<hr><ltbullet>increases the amount of attorney fees and litigation expenses that a court may authorize for a petition for postconviction relief in a death penalty case;<hr><ltbullet>repeals a statute pertaining to capital cases; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.
